intro: Rhynchospora minarum, commonly known as the small spike-rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetlands and marshy areas in North America. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and other grass-like plants. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered spikelets that are typically white or pale green. It thrives in moist to wet soils and is often found in coastal and inland wetlands. Rhynchospora minarum plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
